name: places/ChIJjf0tA5hYwokR4UEm5IV4diA
adrFormatAddress: 1060 5th Ave, New York, NY 10128-0104, USA

originalText.text: I have such a big love and respect to this office. Its a clean, well organized, well equipped place. I especially love dr.Ng, she is a great professional , very kind, very thoughtful. I recommend her to all of my friends. I had 2 babies with Dr.NG and it was such a smooth experience. I am endlessly grateful!

text.text: I have such a big love and respect to this office. Its a clean, well organized, well equipped place. I especially love dr.Ng, she is a great professional , very kind, very thoughtful. I recommend her to all of my friends. I had 2 babies with Dr.NG and it was such a smooth experience. I am endlessly grateful!

originalText.text:
EDIT: When our son turned 1, we learned we needed to have corrective surgery for a condition called hypospadias. Usually if the doctor sees this, they do not perform the circumcision and it is delayed to at least 6 months of age so they then use the foreskin to fix the issues. Not only did the pediatrics at Lenox fail to assess our son properly but Dr. Ng completely messed up our son’s circumcision according to the pediatric urologist and surgeons. Apparently, the circumcision was done so poorly that it seemed to them that someone who didn’t know what they were doing did it.

The anxiety and trauma that this whole thing caused is so miserable and makes me regret the whole decision to deliver at this hospital with this team. I don’t understand how pediatrics at Lenox gave the green light to have the circumcision.

The doctors here are great for anything gynae related, but it’s insane that any doctor but a pediatric surgeon touch your son’s genitals. So please remember that when you choose this practice.

Initial post: Wonderful doctors, very supportive practice.

First of all, I’d always see the doctors on time here, rarely ever any waiting time.

All the doctors are extremely knowledgeable, empathetic and answer all your questions.

I saw Dr. DiGregorio the most during my routine visits and she was great. Super relaxed to talk to, always answered my questions, and gave off a very cool/calm vibe. She even checked on me after delivery while I was in the recovery room at the hospital. She was always prompt to respond to queries via the portal too.

Dr. Elliston delivered my baby, and it was such a lovely experience having her. I can’t say enough good things about her. Even during my check ups, she was extremely thorough, warm, personable, empathetic and gave as much time as we needed, never made us feel rushed. My labor was long, and she was patient, and she always gave us options and let us make the decisions. She was super empathetic and also very supportive of what we wanted. She even impressed my doula with the knowledge she had regarding positions to help with baby’s descent. Overall, it was such a pleasant experience having her.

I only met Dr. Ng twice, once for a checkup and once at the hospital. She did my son’s circumcision and she did a fine job! She was extremely sweet and warm when we met her at our check up, and even when I saw her in the recovery room - she was super understanding of how I was feeling, providing whatever we needed at the time.

I met Dr. DiSturco about two times and she was on call when I went into labor. When I was uncomfortable during a cervical check, she immediately stopped and told me we didn’t have to proceed. That was very encouraging to know, that she put my comfort as a priority. She was also very sweet when we spoke to her when we called once contractions started.

All the doctors at this practice were great. They deliver at Lenox, and the nurses in L & D were mostly great. The ones in the recovery room were hit or miss. It is a teaching hospital which i guess most NY hospitals are, so there were times when residents would come in during the middle of the night and ask questions that you’d wish they came during the day for. During the recovery period, that was quite annoying esp since we were lacking sleep. So the only downside to my experience was the hospital itself. I had a bad experience at the triage one night when I went before labor too. And I was told the day I’m in labor I wouldn’t have to go through the triage and would be admitted directly, that didn’t happen, and I couldn’t have my support person during the cervical check and all. That was a little misguiding.

But overall, I want to give my whole experience with the practice a super thumbs up!

text.text:
EDIT: When our son turned 1, we learned we needed to have corrective surgery for a condition called hypospadias. Usually if the doctor sees this, they do not perform the circumcision and it is delayed to at least 6 months of age so they then use the foreskin to fix the issues. Not only did the pediatrics at Lenox fail to assess our son properly but Dr. Ng completely messed up our son’s circumcision according to the pediatric urologist and surgeons. Apparently, the circumcision was done so poorly that it seemed to them that someone who didn’t know what they were doing did it.

The anxiety and trauma that this whole thing caused is so miserable and makes me regret the whole decision to deliver at this hospital with this team. I don’t understand how pediatrics at Lenox gave the green light to have the circumcision.

The doctors here are great for anything gynae related, but it’s insane that any doctor but a pediatric surgeon touch your son’s genitals. So please remember that when you choose this practice.

originalText.text: I cannot recommend this practice enough! I am so happy to have found 1060 after a not so great experience elsewhere. The offices are very nice and clean. The office staff are very professional and efficient. I was very happy with my prenatal care. They predicted my baby’s weight accurately and they did regular ultrasounds. Dr. Elliston helped deliver my baby and she was so awesome! I had a very positive natural hospital birth and I was never pressured to do anything I didn’t feel comfortable with. She of course explained everything so well and always kept safety in mind. All of the doctors and the nurse practitioner in this practice are personable, professional, kind, skilled and knowledgeable!

text.text: I cannot recommend this practice enough! I am so happy to have found 1060 after a not so great experience elsewhere. The offices are very nice and clean. The office staff are very professional and efficient. I was very happy with my prenatal care. They predicted my baby’s weight accurately and they did regular ultrasounds. Dr. Elliston helped deliver my baby and she was so awesome! I had a very positive natural hospital birth and I was never pressured to do anything I didn’t feel comfortable with. She of course explained everything so well and always kept safety in mind. All of the doctors and the nurse practitioner in this practice are personable, professional, kind, skilled and knowledgeable!

originalText.text:
Extremely rude and unprofessional receptionists - will not be returning. Prefacing the fact I have a job where my schedule changes last minute which i have zero control over. I had an annual appointment scheduled the first week of June with Dr. Elliston that I couldn't make due to a meeting thrown onto my calendar that same day conflicting with my appt. I called the day of to reschedule, and the receptionist tells me they've implemented a new cancellation policy if you cancel past 24 hours you get charged a $30 late fee. I asked her when this policy had taken effect and she said it was recent etc. I was a bit irritated at this point that I had gotten no notification or communications regarding this new change but I reluctantly paid the fee and rescheduled to the 14th. Couldn't make the 14th rescheduled to the 27th (weeks in advance) on the portal and now I had one for tomorrow for 6/27 but again I had a scheduling conflict. I called before the 24 hour mark this morning to reschedule again to one of the days I've taken off in July, and again reception was very rude. She stated she needed my credit card information because I kept needing to reschedule which honestly makes no sense. She then accused me of not attending my appointment last year (which I did and have proof of record from from Dr. Elliston herself via portal) and not going in for my annual 2-3 years prior (wasn't my fault because my insurance was out of network when i was working a different job. this is something I communicated to the doctor as well when I had seen her last year). The receptionist I was spoke to was completely unpleasant, nasty, and unprofessional. I told her I wanted to cancel and no longer want to be part of their practice. Also there's no reason to give you my card information when I actually didn't need to pay the cancellation policy the first time as it was something that I wasn't even made aware of and you basically cornered me on the phone to make me pay it. Super shady and bad business practice.

I understand the conflicts can be frustrating for the staff but they need to understand that not everyone has a rigid schedule. Not sure why they cared after the first time since I was abiding by their stupid cancellation policy and notifying them beyond 24 hours. Definitely won't be returning. Very money hungry and idiotic staff running that office

originalText.text:
I'm sad to write that I had a really disappointing experience with this practice. All of the doctors and staff were lovely during my pregnancy - including an inconclusive NIPT test that (ultimately ended up being fine) but Dr. Ng was really helpful and calming in handling and I greatly appreciated.

Dr. DiSturco though delivered my son in November 2022 and I think I may have been the last patient she had after 3 days on call. It was very clear that she was overworked, uninterested in helping me get through what was a difficult labor, and just trying to get done with her shift. I pushed for 3+ hours and ultimately needed vacuum assistance. I was lacking coordination with my epidural so pushing was obviously not working - and she essentially told me I wasn't doing it right for 3 hours straight in a really demotivating way. That wasn't how I pictured my delivery, but the bedside manner I received was really unfortunate and what I take issue with. The lack of support I felt really affected my first few weeks postpartum and prolonged my feelings of sadness at how my delivery had gone.

I only decided to write this because I did pretty extensive research prior to selecting 1060 and getting pregnant - and only had heard and read good things, including from an OBGYN that highly recommended the practice.
